question_text: Are privileged accounts protected with multi-factor authentication (MFA)?
correct_answer: Yes. MFA is enforced for all privileged accounts accessing production systems.
acceptable_variations: MFA enforced via centralized IdP; hardware or app-based authenticators; documented conditional access rules with no exclusions for privileged roles.
unacceptable_answers: MFA is planned; MFA applies to some admins; MFA recommended but not enforced; password-only access.
required_evidence: IdP MFA configuration; IAM policy; access logs showing MFA challenges for privileged roles.
evidence_quality_bar: Evidence must demonstrate enforcement, not intent or policy language.
notes: Partial MFA coverage or undocumented exceptions typically result in audit findings.
